alert.note: Alert for Butler; Cowley (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 8:58PM CDT until May 08 at 8:40AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kansas... Walnut River at Winfield affecting Butler and Cowley Counties. Walnut River at Augusta affecting Butler and Cowley Counties. For the Walnut River...including Augusta, Winfield...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Walnut River at Winfield. * WHEN...From this evening to Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Flood waters flow over County Road Cowley 2 west of the city of Rock. Then 4 miles northwest of Winfield, Cowley County Road 18 floods over a section just west of 71st Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:31 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 19.1 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.1 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Walnut River Winfield 18.0 19.1 Thu 8 pm CDT 19.9 18.7 9.9 &&
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
